newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Gasunie drops Belgian gas pipeline plans -Distrigas.
newsitem.headline: Gasunie drops Belgian gas pipeline plans -Distrigas.

text.p: Dutch gas distributor Nederlandse Gasunie has dropped plans to build its own pipeline in Belgium to import gas from Britain, Belgian counterpart Distrigas said on Tuesday.

"The option to have their own line is no longer being considered; they are abandoning the project of a line from Zeebrugge to the Dutch border," Distrigas chief executive officer Jean-Pierre Depaemelaere told a news conference following Distrigas's annual shareholders' meeting.
But he added that Gasunie was carrying out a feasibility study for other gas import projects.
Gasunie had received preliminary permission from the Flemish regional government late last year to build an underground pipeline between Zeebrugge and Ossendrecht at the Dutch-Belgian border.
Such a pipeline could feed British gas imports directly into the Dutch network once the Interconnector pipeline from Bacton on Britain's east coast to Zeebrugge was completed in late 1998.
